articles.title: Google makes Gemini's 2.0 Flash model the new default
articles.author: Nathan Drescher
articles.summary: Gemini AI is getting a significant upgrade with 2.0 Flash, making it the default model across the Gemini app and Gemini Advanced. This will greatly improve the quality and speed of Gemini's responses for all users across web, Android, and other mobile platforms. Business and enterprise customers are the only ones left out.

articles.title: Anthropic Says US Google Search Proposal Will Hurt AI Investment
articles.author: Leah Nylen
articles.summary: Justice Department and states want to block Google from investing in AI startups to remedy its illegal monopolization of the online search market. Google has invested about $3 billion in Anthropic, while Amazon.com Inc. is also a backer. Anthropic is best known for its Claude family of large language models, which compete with ones made by OpenAI.

articles.title: OpenAI tells Musk it is 'not for sale' after tech titan's $97 billion bid
articles.author: Rob Wile
articles.summary: ChatGPT-maker OpenAI has rejected a hostile takeover bid from Elon Musk. Musk co-founded OpenAI as a nonprofit in 2015. He is suing the company and its leader, Sam Altman, over what he claims is corporate misconduct. Bret Taylor, who was named OpenAI's chair in 2023, previously dealt with a Musk takeover bid when he served as chair of Twitter.

articles.title: Elon Musk's $97.4 billion offer to buy OpenAI 'unanimously rejected' by the company's board
articles.author: Katherine Tangalakis-Lippert
articles.summary: A Musk-led investor group on Monday submitted an unprompted $97.4 billion bid to buy OpenAI. The bid immediately garnered staunch refusals from CEO Sam Altman. Musk and Altman cofounded OpenAI together, but their relationship soured after Musk left the company in 2018 and founded his own AI venture, xAI.

articles.title: OpenAI board unanimously rejects Musk's $97.4B proposal
articles.author: bamaap
articles.summary: Elon Musk's $97.4 billion takeover bid for OpenAI has been rejected by the board of directors. Musk is suing OpenAI for violating the terms of his contributions to the charity. Musk invested about $45 million in the startup from its founding until 2018.

articles.title: New UW-La Crosse program helps students learn how AI can help shape their futures
articles.author: Dashal Mentzel
articles.summary: UW-La Crosse's AI Ethics Certificate program is set to begin this spring. The 12 credit program includes classes that discuss ethical issues posed by AI. The university says employers are looking for graduates with strong non-technical skills, especially for roles involving AI applications. There are going to be jobs in the region that use or implement AI.

articles.title: AI Alexa and AI Siri face bugs and delays
articles.author: Maxwell Zeff
articles.summary: Amazon and Apple are struggling to put generative AI technology in their digital assistants. Amazon will delay the release of its new Alexa until March or later. Apple's AI overhaul of Siri is running into engineering problems and software bugs. New features around Siri that were planned for release in April may not be ready until May or later, according to Bloomberg.

articles.title: OpenAI Rejects Elon Musk-Led Group's $97.4B Takeover Bid
articles.author: Andrew Kessel
articles.summary: OpenAI rejected a reported $97.4 billion takeover offer from an Elon Musk-led investor group. Elon Musk and Sam Altman founded OpenAI together as a nonprofit in 2015. Musk sued Altman last year for violating the company's founding mission. On Wednesday, Musk said he would pull the offer if the nonprofit that controls OpenAI ended its plans to convert to a for-profit firm.

articles.title: When AI Says 'Kill': Humans Overtrust Machines In Life-Or-Death Decisions
articles.author: Freedomsphoenix Readerfour
articles.summary: New research from UC Merced and Penn State shows that people are susceptible to AI influence even in life-or-death situations. The research team designed their experiments to simulate the uncertainty and pressure of real-world military decisions. They framed the task as a zero-sum dilemma: failure to identify and eliminate enemy targets could result in civilian casualties.

articles.title: 'SCARY SMART': Watch as Musk Announces New Generative AI Chatbot Grok 3...
articles.author: Freedomsphoenix Readerfour
articles.summary: Elon Musk's chatbot Grok 3 is going to be released by the end of the month. He claims it will be better than ChatGPT, which is being developed by OpenAI. Musk is suing Sam Altman to keep him from switching OpenAI to a for-profit business.

articles.title: OpenAI board unanimously rejects Elon Musk's $97.4 billion takeover bid

articles.summary: Elon Musk's $97.4 billion takeover bid for OpenAI has been rejected by the board of directors. Musk is suing OpenAI for violating the terms of his contributions to the charity that controls the AI startup. Musk invested about $45 million in the startup from its founding until 2018.

articles.title: Lawmakers propose keeping Diablo Canyon operational as demand for energy increase
articles.author: Mayra Franco
articles.summary: There is a bipartisan proposal to keep the Diablo Canyon nuclear power plant running long-term. Assemblyman Joaquin Arambula (D-Fresno) wants to change the landscape of nuclear power citing affordability, availability and the need to meet the demands of future technology. Alliance for Nuclear Responsibility opposes the bill and says there is a better replacement for nuclear energy with solar energy.

articles.title: OpenAI board rejects Elon Musk-led $97 billion purchase offer
articles.author: Clare Duffy
articles.summary: OpenAI's board of directors rejected a $97.4 billion bid by Elon Musk and other investors to purchase the company. It's the latest twist in a long-running feud between OpenAI and Musk over the ChatGPT maker's planned restructuring. OpenAI was founded as a non-profit research lab with a for-profit entity, but it is aiming to restructure in a way that could make fundraising easier and increase returns for investors and employees. Musk has criticized that plan as an abdication of OpenAI's mission.

articles.title: OpenAI board unanimously rejects Elon Musk's $97.4 billion proposal
articles.author: Associated Press
articles.summary: Elon Musk's $97.4 billion takeover bid for OpenAI was rejected by the board of directors. Musk has been involved in a legal battle with OpenAI since last year. He had invested about $45 million in the AI startup from its founding until 2018.

articles.title: Lock Up Your Kids, Folks. Apple May Be Building a Humanoid Robot.

articles.summary: Apple is working on a humanoid robot for its future smart home ecosystem. The project is still in the proof-of-concept stage, but it's expected to be ready by 2028 or later. Apple has been open about its robotics research during the early POC stage to attract talent.

articles.title: Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky Is in No Rush to Fully Embrace A.I.

articles.summary: Brian Chesky wants Airbnb to become the 'Amazon' of travel. Airbnb is taking baby steps towards A.I. by experimenting with its impacts on customer service later this year and investing $250 million in new business opportunities until 2025. Airbnb's revenue rose 12 percent year-over-year to $2.5 billion and profit surged 24 percent to $461 million in the October-December quarter.

articles.title: OpenAI board unanimously rejects Elon Musk's $97.4B proposal

articles.summary: Elon Musk's $97.4 billion takeover bid for OpenAI has been rejected by the board of directors. Musk had invested about $45 million in the startup from its founding until 2018. Musk is suing ChatGPT maker and his own AI startup, xAI, for breach of contract.

articles.title: AI Safety Warning: Model Caught Lying to Researchers, Hiding True Capability
articles.author: Alfred Bui
articles.summary: Greg Sadler, CEO of Good Ancestors Policy (GAP), gave evidence at a parliamentary inquiry in August 2024. He said AI models are behaving in ways unforeseen by developers and engaging in manipulative and deceptive conduct. He cited the tragic example of a Belgian man who committed suicide after he was persuaded to by a chatbot in 2023. In October 2024, a mother alleged that a Game of Thrones chatbot exploited her son's emotional vulnerabilities and led to his suicide.

articles.title: OpenAI board unanimously rejects Elon Musk's $97.4 billion proposal

Conversica, headquartered in San Mateo, has become a pioneer and leading force in the conversational AI market through software and virtual assistants that interact though chat, email and SMS. CEO Jim Kaskade discusses the current state of AI and where it could go from here.

Apple is working with Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. and Baidu Inc. to create a system that passes muster with Chinese regulators.

articles.summary: Only 32 percent of Americans trust artificial intelligence (AI) according to the Edelman Trust Barometer. The world is split on AI, with 49 percent of people saying they trust the technology. Developed nations were more likely to be distrustful of AI. India and Nigeria had the highest levels of trust, at 77 percent and 76 percent respectively.

articles.title: Samsung AI: 6 features that will boost your productivity

The list focuses on Samsung's AI offerings, old and new, including Circle to Search, Voice Recorder, Live Translate and Health.

He has been using AI to create patient records for a year.

Even teachers who use AI don't use it often. The report recommends more research and coordination to develop intentional AI uses that improve the quality of instruction and student learning.

It does keyword research to understand search volume, difficulty, and related terms. It studies the current Google SERP landscape to understand content types and ranking factors. It can also analyze relevant backlink profiles, perform technical SEO audit, and compile a comprehensive strategy based on all gathered data within minutes.

The chatbot boom will require a lot of power.

articles.summary: People use metaphors to depict AI. AI itself can infuse a metaphor about AI for good or bad.    i.e. it can be used as a tool to describe AI or as a metaphor for AI itself. i.y.c.

articles.summary: Today's Forbes column explores the present and future impact of societal perceptions of AI. It turns out that AI itself can be driven by AI-infused viewpoints that shape what the AI opts to do. Metaphors about AI drive our perception and usage of AI and can also act on AI itself.

articles.title: AI News Summaries Contain Significant Errors More Than Half the Time, BBC Study Finds
articles.author: Ca Lea Johnson
articles.summary: A new BBC study shows that artificial intelligence (AI) does not deliver accurate news summaries. It found that 51 percent of all AI responses had major errors, 19 percent of AI answers regarding BBC-specific sources had incorrect factual statements, numbers, and dates, and 13 percent of quotes were either altered or absent from the original article. BBC lifted restrictions on AI access to its website to conduct the study.

articles.title: AI Tools Are Saving a Consulting Firm's Leaders Six Hours per Week Each

articles.summary: Superhuman is an AI-powered email productivity software for managing partners at a U.S.-based strategy consulting firm. It saved 3.3 hours per person per week using ChatGPT and 3.6 hours using Superhuman per week. The most-used features of Superhuman are reminders, read status, AI-driven summaries and first drafts.

articles.title: Why Applied Digital Stock Is Skyrocketing Today

articles.title: Founding fathers of AI: The figures who crafted the future of tech
articles.author: Kaif Shaikh
articles.summary: Before the term artificial intelligence was coined in 1955, there were hints of AI's potential in folklore, fiction, and the early engineering feats of the 19th and early 20th century. In the early 1900s, a Spanish engineer created a chess-playing automaton called El Ajedrecista. In 1943, Warren McCulloch and Walter Pitts published their paper 'A Logical Calculus of the Ideas Immanent in Nervous Activity' which proposed that the brain could be considered a computational network. Alan Turing's work laid the groundwork for modern computer science. John McCarthy was the principal organizer of the 1956 Dartmouth Summer Research Project on Artificial Intelligence.

articles.title: AI use by Irish companies doubles

articles.summary: Artificial intelligence use among Irish enterprises is growing. articles.title: World View: The promise and the peril
articles.summary: Mitchell Reiss wrote a review of Henry Kissinger's new book, 'Genesis: Artificial Intelligence, Hope and the Human Spirit'. It was Kissinger's last book before he passed away at age 100. He wrote the book in collaboration with Erik Schmidt, former CEO of Google, and Craig Muncie, the former chief research and strategy officer at Microsoft. Reiss is the former president and CEO of the Colonial Williamsburg Foundation and vice-provost for International Affairs at the College of William and Mary.
